intro: Ehretia lengshuikengensis, commonly known as the Lengshuikeng ehretia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to China, specifically the Yunnan Province, where it grows in humid, mountainous regions. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers with yellow petals. It is often found in secondary forests and along stream banks, thriving in shaded, moist environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
